alert.note: Alert for Coastal Liberty; Coastal McIntosh; Inland McIntosh; Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MCINTOSH AND LONG COUNTIES... At 418 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Townsend, or near Tibet, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Tibet, Jones, Wolf Island, Eulonia, Valona, South Newport, Meridian and Townsend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch is in effect. Thunderstorms can produce tornadoes suddenly, sometimes with little or no warning. Be alert for rapidly changing weather conditions and be ready to act quickly if severe weather is observed or a warning is issued. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
